title.narrative: Education Support Programme to Afghanistan II

description.narrative: The Education Support Programme to Afghanistan phase two (ESPA II) is a two-year program covering the period January 2013 to December 2014. The development objective of the ESPA II is fully aligned to the Afghanistan National Development Strategy 2008-2013 (ANDS) and fully supports the National Education Strategic Plan II/Education Interim Plan. The objectives of the national development strategies and education sector strategies are in accordance with the rights based approach to development and are an integrated part of the ESPA II. The vision of the education strategic plan is to develop human capital based on Islamic principles, national and international commitments and respect for human rights by providing equitable access to quality education for all to enable them to actively participate in sustainable development, economic growth, and stability and security of Afghanistan. The Danish contribution is primarily on-budget support to the education strategic plan, which comprises five programmes, each with specific development goals: 1) general and Islamic education, 2) Curriculum Development and Teacher Education, 3) Technical and Vocational Education and Training, 4) literacy, and 5) Education Management. Apart from supporting the Ministry of Education ESPA II support projects directly with implementing partners, external consultants and other costs associated with the education support program. The projects are aimed to support and complement the activities implemented directly by the Ministry of Education, and are implemented in close coordination with the Ministry of Education.
